content.text:
# List of suicides in the 21st century

:This list of previous suicides is incomplete; you can help by [|action=edit}} expanding it.]
The following are notable peoples who died by suicide in the year 2000 and after. Suicides under duress are included. Deaths by accident or misadventure are excluded. Individuals who might or might not have died by their own hand, or whose intention to die is in dispute, but who are widely believed to have deliberately died by suicide, may be listed under Possible suicides.
Confirmed suicides
A
{| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;"
|-
! Name !! Suicide year !! Causes and explanations
|-
|Carole Achache
|2016
| French writer, photographer and actress, hanging
|-
|Phillip Adams
|2021
|American football player, shot himself during standoff with police a day after fatally shooting 6 people. Actions are believed to be linked to Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy
|-
| Stephanie Adams || 2018 || American former glamour model, known as the November 1992 Playboy Playmate, jumped from a 25th floor window after pushing her seven-year-old son Vincent out the same window.
|-
| Stuart Adamson || 2001 || Scottish guitarist and singer (Big Country, Skids), hanging after alcohol ingestion.
|-
| Ahn Jae-hwan || 2008 || South Korean actor, carbon monoxide poisoning
|-
| Chantal Akerman || 2015 || Belgian film director. Was previously hospitalized for depression.
|-
| Leelah Alcorn || 2014 || American transgender teenager, walked in front of a truck
|-
|Ekaterina Alexandrovskaya
|2020
|Russian-Australian ice skater, jumped from window of her apartment
|-
| Michael Alfonso, known under the ring name Mike Awesome || 2007 || American professional wrestler, hanging
|-
| Gia Allemand || 2013 || American actress and model, hanging
|-
| August Ames || 2017 || Canadian pornographic actress and model, suffered from bipolar depression and dissociative identity disorder, hanged herself after backlash to a controversial tweet.
|-
| Desmond Amofah, known online as Etika || 2019 || American YouTuber and streamer, died by suicide after battling with mental illness for months, as well as bullying, drowned.
|-
|Gonçalo Amorim
|2012
|Portuguese cyclist, gunshot
|-
| Sophie Anderson || 2023 || English pornographic actress and internet personality, GHB overdose
|-
| Keith Andes || 2005 || American actor, asphyxiation
|-
|Kei Aoyama
|2011
|Japanese manga artist, hanging
|-
|Gustavo Arnal
|2022
|Chief Financial Officer of Bed Bath & Beyond, jumping Arnal was accused of being involved in a 'pump and dump scheme' before his death
|-
|Sei Ashina
|2020
|Japanese actress, method undisclosed
|-
| John Atchison || 2007 || American federal prosecutor and alleged child sex offender, hanging
|-
| Atsumi Yoshikubo || 2014 || Japanese psychiatrist, intentionally getting lost in the Canadian Taiga.
|-
|Mohamed Atta
|2001
|Egyptian member of Al-Qaeda, and leader of the 9/11 hijackers, plane crash of American Airlines Flight 11
|-
|Pekka-Eric Auvinen
|2007
|Finnish Jokela High School shooter, gunshot
|}

{| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;"
|-
! Name !! Suicide year !! Causes and explanations
|-
| Nikki Bacharach || 2007 || Daughter of Burt Bacharach and Angie Dickinson, was diagnosed with visual impairment and Asperger syndrome, suffocated
|-
|Jeff Baena
|2025
|American screenwriter and film director
|-
|Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi
|2019
|Iraqi-born Islamic terrorist and leader of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant, detonation of a suicide vest
|-
| Mark Balelo || 2013 || Cast member on the reality TV series Storage Wars, asphyxiation, days after an arrest for drug charges.
|-
| Pratyusha Banerjee || 2016 || Indian actress, hanging, although her parents speculate that her boyfriend murdered her and staged her suicide
|-
|Johanna Bassani
|2020
|Austrian combined Nordic skier and ski jumper
|-
| Simone Battle || 2014 || X Factor contestant and member of the pop band G.R.L., hanging, due to depression over financial issues
|-
| J. Clifford Baxter || 2002 || American Enron Corporation executive, gunshot
|-
|Ari Behn
|2019
|Norwegian author and painter, suffered from depression and other mental health issues, alcoholism, and loneliness
|-
| Jovan Belcher || 2012 || American football player, shot himself after killing his girlfriend Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy is believed to have contributed.
|-
| Jadin Bell || 2013 || Oregon teen who was taken off life support after he attempted suicide by hanging himself. He was driven to take his own life because he was bullied for being gay, according to his family.
|-
| Malik Bendjelloul || 2014 || Swedish documentary filmmaker, jumped in front of moving train, he was struggling with depression
|-
| Chester Bennington || 2017 || American singer and songwriter (Linkin Park), hanging, had struggled with substance abuse and depression
|-
| Chris Benoit || 2007 || Canadian professional wrestler, hanged himself after killing his wife and son; had suffered from dementia, depression, and possible  traumatic brain injury
|-
| Tim Bergling, aka Avicii || 2018 || Swedish DJ and music producer, self-inflicted cuts resulting in blood loss, suffered from anxiety, alcoholism, drug addiction, and depression
|-
| David Berman || 2019 || American musician, singer, poet and cartoonist best known for his work with indie-rock bands the Silver Jews and Purple Mountains, hanging. Previously attempted suicide in 2003, suffered from depression, anxiety, and drug addiction
|-
| Byron "Reckful" Bernstein || 2020 || Former professional Esports player – best known for World of Warcraft, pioneer of streaming on Twitch.tv. He battled with depression for more than 20 years.
|-
| Paul Bhattacharjee || 2013 || British actor, jumped from a clifftop a day after he had been declared bankrupt, he suffered from severe depression
|-
|Brian Bianchini
|2004
|American male model, hanging, suffered from depression
|-
|Abraham Biggs
|2008
|American college student who livestreamed his suicide on the video broadcasting website Justin.tv, overdose of opiates and benzodiazepines He had been struggling with bipolar disorder
|-
|Steve Bing
|2020
|American businessman and film producer, jumped from 27th floor of apartment building
|-
| Bob Birch || 2012 || American musician; gunshot, he had severe gastrointestinal issues brought on by a 1995 car accident, and suffered from extreme insomnia
|-
| David Birnie || 2005 || Australian serial killer and rapist, hanging
|-
| Jeremy Blake || 2007 || American artist, drowning, possible motive was harassment from Scientologists
|-
|Erica Blasberg
|2010
|American golfer, asphyxia caused by prescription overdose, found with a dust mask on her mouth, and plastic bag over her head
|-
| Miguel Blesa || 2017 || Spanish banker and businessman, involved in various corruption scandals, gunshot to chest
|-
| Isabella Blow || 2007 || English magazine editor, and muse to fashion designer Alexander McQueen, poisoning, suffered from bipolar disorder, as well as depression after a cancer diagnosis and fading celebrity status
|-
| Eduardo Bonvallet || 2015 || Chilean World Cup footballer and pundit, known for his strong opinions, hanging, suffered from depression
|-
|Novak Bošković
|2019
|Serbian handball player, gunshot
|-
|Dmitry Bosov
|2020
|Russian businessman and billionaire, gunshot
|-
| Stephen "tWitch" Boss || 2022 || American dancer, self-inflicted gunshot to head
|-
|Mohamed Bouazizi
|2011
|Tunisian street vendor, self-immolation, set himself on fire in retaliation for having his wares stolen, and being harassed. His suicide sparked the Tunisian Revolution.
|-
| Anthony Bourdain || 2018 || American chef, author, and television personality, hanging, suicide "appeared to be an impulsive act".
|-
| Jonathan Brandis || 2003 || American actor, hanging, he was depressed about his career, which had slowly declined in recent years, and he was drinking heavily.
|-
|Charlie Brandt
|2004
|American serial killer, hanging
|-
|Blake Brockington
|2015
|American LGBT advocate who was the first openly transgender homecoming king in the state of North Carolina, vehicular impact He had been struggling with severe depression
|-
|Molly Brodak
|2020
|American poet, writer, and baker, she struggled with depression since childhood
|-
| Herman Brood || 2001 || Dutch musician, artist, composer, jumping from the roof of the Hilton Hotel Amsterdam, he was depressed by the failure of his drug rehabilitation program, and was facing serious medical problems due to his prolonged drug use
|-
| Joseph Brooks || 2011 || American screenwriter, director, producer, and composer known for the song "You Light Up My Life" Brooks had been indicted on multiple rape and sexual assault allegations, but died by suicide before he could be tried. The day after Brooks' death, the medical examiner ruled that Brooks had killed himself, citing asphyxia, he was facing sexual assault charges.
|-
| Jürgen Brümmer || 2014 || German Olympic gymnast (1988), jumping from the Körsch Viaduct, Shortly afterwards, his 15-year-old son, who was in need of ongoing care since an accident two years before, was found dead in his home, evidently having been suffocated by Brümmer.
|-
| David Buckel || 2018 || American LGBT rights lawyer and environmental activist, self-immolation in Prospect Park, Brooklyn, set self on fire in protest of the use of fossil fuels
|-
| Julia Buencamino|| 2015||  15-year-old Filipina actress found hanging from the ceiling of her bedroom's bathroom with a nylon rope looped around her neck on the night of July 7, 2015.
|-
| Brad Bufanda || 2017 || American actor, jumped from building
|-
| Aaron Bushnell || 2024 || Member of the United States Air Force, self-immolated in protest of American involvement in the Gaza war
|}

{| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;"
|-
! Name !! Suicide year !! Causes and explanations
|-
| Homaro Cantu || 2015 ||  American chef, hanging, had no history of depression or mental illness, left no suicide note
|-
| Capital Steez || 2012||  American hip-hop artist, unhappy with his career, jumped off the rooftop of the Cinematic Music Group headquarters in Manhattan
|-
| Kagney Linn Karter || 2024|| American pornographic film actress, suicide with shotgun blast in mouth in Cuyahoga County, Ohio on February 15, 2024. Her death was reported by TMZ four days later.
|-
| Tim Carter || 2008||  Footballer, hanging, he was struggling to deal with his son's disabilities
|-
| Neal Casal || 2019 || American musician
|-
| Finn M. W. Caspersen || 2009||  American financier and philanthropist, gunshot, after battle with cancer and anticipated financial problems
|-
| Ariel Castro || 2013||  Puerto Rican American man convicted in August 2013 of kidnapping, rape, and aggravated murder for holding Amanda Berry, Michelle Knight, and Gina DeJesus in his Cleveland, Ohio, home over the course of a decade, hanging
|-
|Fidel Castro Díaz-Balart
|2018
|Cuban nuclear physicist, son of Fidel Castro, suffered from depression
|-
| Kelly Catlin || 2019||  American cyclist, asphyxiation suffered from depression, suffered a concussion months prior to her suicide
|-
| Antonio Catricalà || 2021||  Italian civil servant and lawyer, gunshot
|-
| Champignon || 2013||  Brazilian musician, bassist for Charlie Brown Jr., gunshot to head, suffered from depression and anxiety, was distraught over criticism, insecurity, and financial struggles
|-
|Nicole Chan
|2019
|Canadian police officer who died after making allegations of sexual coercion.
|-
|Joseph Newton Chandler III
|2002
|Formerly unidentified identity thief, gunshot after having been diagnosed with recurrent cancer
|-
|Pierre Chanal
|2003
|French soldier and alleged serial killer
|-
| Iris Chang || 2004||  American historian and author of The Rape of Nanking, gunshot wound to the mouth, she had an extreme bout of depression and reactive psychosis
|-
| Danny Chen || 2011||  Chinese-American U.S. Army Private, gunshot, he was tortured, harassed, assaulted, and bullied relentlessly by his fellow soldiers for being of Asian descent.
|-
| Vic Chesnutt || 2009||  American country-folk singer-songwriter, intentional overdose of muscle relaxants., was unable to receive insurance due to his quadriplegia following a car accident in 1983, and was $50,000 in debt due to medical bills.
|-
| Leslie Cheung || 2003||  Hong Kong singer,  jumped off the 24th floor of the hotel Mandarin Oriental, having been diagnosed with severe clinical depression.
|-
|V. J. Chitra
|2020
|Indian actress, hanging, her husband was suspected of encouraging her to die by suicide
|-
| Seung-Hui Cho || 2007||  American university student who perpetrated the Virginia Tech shooting, gunshot
|-
|Choi Jin-sil
|2008
|South Korean actress, hanging, likely due to grief resulting from her friend, Ahn Jae-hwan's, suicide
|-
|Choi Jin-young
|2010
|South Korean actor and singer, hanging, suffered from depression after his sister, Choi Jin-sil, died by suicide in 2008. Jin-young had attempted suicide several times, including once by drug overdose in 2009.
|-
|Chung Doo-un
|2019
|South Korean politician
|-
|Brian Christopher
|2018
|American professional wrestler, hanging, found in his cell after being incarcerated for driving under the influence and public intoxication
|-
| Tyler Clementi || 2010||  Gay American student at Rutgers University, jumped off the George Washington Bridge after his roommate secretly observed him with a webcam, kissing his date
|-
|Camila María Concepción
|2020
|American screenwriter and transgender rights activist
|-
|Tarka Cordell
|2008
|British musician, hanging
|-
| Don Cornelius || 2012||  American television show host and producer, best known as the creator and host of the nationally syndicated dance/music franchise Soul Train, gunshot. He had been suffering from seizures, possibly suffered from the early stages of dementia or Alzheimer's disease.
|-
|Chris Cornell || 2017||  American musician, singer and songwriter (Soundgarden, Audioslave, Temple of the Dog), hanging after performance, suffered from depression, anxiety, and drug addiction. Prescription drugs at therapeutic doses were found in his system.
|-
|John Coughlin
|2019
|American figure skater, hanging, was accused of sexual assault, and was accused by more women after his death
|-
|Julee Cruise
|2022
|American musician. She struggled with lupus, depression and alcohol and drug addiction.
|-
| Smiley Culture || 2011||  English reggae singer and DJ, stabbed himself during police raid
|-
|Eylül Cansın
|2015
|Turkish transgender woman who was exploited into sex work, jumping
|-
|Antonio Calvo
|2011
|Senior lecturer in Spanish at Princeton University, cut his throat and arms. He died by suicide after being either suspended from the university, or having his employment contract abruptly terminated, as this meant that he would lose his residence visa and possibly face deportation.
|-
|Chen Gang
|2011
|Chinese university lecturer, jumping. He died by suicide after losing to a rival, which he attributed to corruption in the university.
|}
D

! Name !! Suicide year !! Causes and explanations
|-
| Yasmim Gabrielle Fernandes da Silva|| 2019|| 17-year-old Brazilian TV presenter, overdose of sleeping pills, due to depression
|-
| Charlotte Dawson|| 2014||  Australian TV presenter, died by suicide via hanging
|-
| Brad Delp|| 2007 ||  American rock musician (Boston), died by suicide via carbon monoxide poisoning after suffering from depression due to lingering hard feelings from Boston's disbandment in the 1980s and personal tension with bandleader Scholz.
|-
| Ronald Desruelles|| 2015||  Belgian athlete, died by suicide via hanging, he was depressed after the failure of his business
|-
|Dipendra Bir Bikram Shah
|2001
|King of Nepal and perpetrator of the Nepalese royal massacre, died by suicide via gunshot to the head
|-
|Thomas M. Disch
|2008
|American writer, suicide by gunshot, he suffered from depression following the death of his long-term partner, Charles Naylor.
|-
| Christopher Dorner|| 2013||  American police officer, suicide by gunshot in Angelus Oaks, California, after killing his former colleagues. He allegedly committed the act in retaliation against his former workplace, after being fired for reporting excessive force
|-
| Jon Dough|| 2006||  American pornographic actor, hanging, he suffered from depression and alcoholism
|-
|Edward Downes
|2009
|English conductor, assisted double suicide with wife Lady Joan Downes at the Dignitas clinic in Switzerland, had suffered from increasing hearing impairment, as well as near total blindness, and his wife had terminal cancer.
|-
| Scott Dozier|| 2019||  American murderer on death row in Nevada after the 2002 murder of 22-year-old Jeremiah Miller, hanging
|-
| Charmaine Dragun|| 2007 ||  Australian television newsreader, jumped off The Gap, an oceanside cliff in Sydney, after a long battle with depression
|-
| Dave Duerson|| 2011||  American football player, gunshot, posthumous research of his brain found chronic traumatic encephalopathy after years of concussions in his football career
|-
| Clay Duke|| 2010||  American ex-convict, gunshot, opened fire on the Panama City school board during a meeting after his wife, Rebecca, who was a teacher in the school district, was fired. After getting hit by a bullet from a security officer's pistol, Duke collapsed and then used a remaining bullet in his gun to kill himself.
|-
| Theresa Duncan|| 2007||  American video game designer, blogger, filmmaker, and critic. Her partner Jeremy Blake also died by suicide. The couple were both being harassed by Scientologists prior to their deaths.
|-
|Aleksandr Dolmatov
|2013
|Russian opposition activist and asylum seeker, undisclosed method. He was found dead by suicide in a deportation centre in the Netherlands, after being denied political asylum, which he was seeking in order to avoid arrest in Russia due to his participation in the 2011-2013 Russian protests.
|-
|Denice Denton
|2006
|American professor of electrical engineering, academic administrator, and ninth chancellor of the University of California, Santa Cruz, jumped 33 stories off of The Paramount. She died by suicide one day after being released from a psychiatric institute, where she had been treated for depression. She had been harassed and threatened a year prior.
|}

! Name !! Suicide year !! Causes and explanations

|2007
|German serial killer, hanging
|-
|Naima El Bezaz
|2020
|Moroccan-Dutch writer, suffered from depression for most of her life

| Keith Emerson || 2016 || English keyboardist, gunshot, he suffered from depression, alcoholism, and anxiety about future performances, due to increasing nerve damage and pain, which hindered his ability to play the keyboard
|-
|Martin Emond
|2004
|New Zealand cartoonist and painter, hanging
|-
| Robert Enke || 2009 || German football goalkeeper, impact by train near Neustadt am Rübenberge, he had been suffering from depression for six years, and was distraught over the death of his daughter Lara in 2006
|-
|Jeffrey Epstein
|2019
|American financier and sex offender. Found dead in his prison cell, officially determined to be a suicide.
|-
|Richard Evonitz
|2002
|American serial killer and kidnapper; gunshot
|-
|Dolly Everett
|2018
|Australian face of the Akubra hat brand, undisclosed method. Her suicide is largely attributed to cyberbullying.
|}

|English artist, died by suicide via hanging

|2014
|Brazilian pianist, winner of the 1985 Van Cliburn International Piano Competition, gunshot to head

| Mark Fisher || 2017|| Critical theorist and cultural critic, hanging. Fisher detailed his struggles with depression throughout his writing, especially in the pages of Capitalist Realism: Is There No Alternative?.

| David Fonseca || 2015|| Former Belize City mayor, gunshot to head
|-

|-
| Danny Frawley || 2019||  Former Australian Rules footballer and broadcaster, suicide by intentional car accident. His brain was tested two year later, and he was found to have been suffering from stage two chronic traumatic encephalopathy
|-
| Ryan Freel || 2012||  American professional baseball player, gunshot, suffered from depression, anxiety, ADHD, bipolar disorder, and impulse control disorder, also had stage two chronic traumatic encephalopathy
|-
|Keith Flint || 2019||  English vocalist and dancer most associated with The Prodigy, hanging, he suffered from depression and drug addiction prior to his marriage; the depression might have resurfaced

|Verónica Forqué
|2021
|Spanish actress, suicide by hanging after a long depression.
|-
|Kelly Fraser
|2019
|Canadian pop singer and songwriter, she experienced racism, cyberbullying, and childhood trauma
|-
|Amina El Filali
|2012
|Moroccan teenager forced to marry her rapist, rat poison.
|-
|Christopher Foster
|2008
|Businessman, killed his wife, daughter, horses and dogs before setting the family house on fire, gunshot and self-immolation
|}

|-
! Name !! Suicide year !! Causes and explanations
|-
| Goo Hara|| 2019||  South Korean singer and actress, former member of K-Pop group Kara, found dead at her home after being cyber-bullied by malicious commenters, due to a scandal that involved her and her abusive ex-boyfriend. It was confirmed in 2019 that she was suffering from depression. She was also being neglected by her mother who abandoned her family when Goo was a child.
|-
|Anthony Galindo
|2020
|Venezuelan singer, he suffered from depression, apparently due to the frequent cancellations of his shows following the COVID-19 pandemic
|-

|-
|Jamir Garcia

|2021
|Uruguayan soccer player, gunshot, had been receiving psychiatric treatment

|2021
|American gymnastics coach, gunshot, shortly after being charged with 24 felony counts related to sexual abuse of his trainees
|-
|Babak Ghorbani
|2014
|Iranian wrestler, overdose, was charged with murder in 2012, which is a possible factor that led to his suicide
|-
| Sam Gillespie || 2003|| Australian philosopher whose writings and translations were crucial to the initial reception of Alain Badiou's work in the English-speaking world
|-
| Jeremy Giambi || 2022|| American professional baseball player, gunshot, suffered from depression and paranoia after being struck in the head by a baseball about six months before his death
|-

|2005
|Australian serial killer, hanging.
|-

|2022

|2018

|2023
|Singaporean police sergeant who faced workplace bullying and racial discrimination, jumping.

| Lucy Gordon || 2009||  British actress and model, hanging after an argument with her boyfriend, cinematographer Jerome Alveras
|-
|Gōri Daisuke
|2010
|Japanese voice actor, narrator and actor, cut his wrist, was depressed about fading vision caused by diabetes, which hindered his ability to work
|-
|Sophie Gradon
|2018
|English model and television personality, hanging, possibly due to cyberbullying
|-
|Bob Grant
|2003
|English actor, carbon monoxide poisoning, suffered from depression, bipolar disorder, and other mental health issues, was also struggling with debt and lack of work
|-
| Spalding Gray || 2004||American actor, playwright, screenwriter, performance artist, and monologuist, jumped off the Staten Island Ferry, was severely injured and depressed after a car accident in 2001
|-
| Mark Green || 2004||  American record-setting minor league hockey star, hanged himself after being accused of stealing from a car dealership
|-
|Paul Gruchow
|2004
|American writer, drug overdose, suffered from depression

|2017
|Chinese novelist and director

|Indian nurse, hanging. She died by suicide after falling for a prank phone call that was a part of a radio stunt. She had attempted suicide on two previous occasions, and had been taking antidepressants.

|Bill Sparkman
|2009
|American teacher, asphyxia. Originally reported as a homicide, it was later discovered that Sparkman had died by suicide, and staged the incident so that his family could collect life insurance rather than die of cancer.

Possible suicides
{| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;"
|-
! Name !! Suicide year !! Causes and explanations
|-
|Wade Belak
|2011
|Canadian ice hockey player. Belak was found dead in his home in Toronto, and the police investigated his death as a suicide. Later, hockey analyst and former player P.J. Stock alleged that Belak's death was not a suicide, but accidental. Although Stock later stepped back from his comments, members of Belak's family also believe his death was accidental.
|-
|Rick Genest
|2018
|Performance artist, actor and model, fall from a balcony.
|-
|Kizito Mihigo
|2020
|Rwandan gospel singer, genocide survivor and peace activist, found hanging. Human rights organisations and Rwandan activists challenged this.
|-
| Elliott Smith || 2003 || American musician, stab wounds to chest. His death was originally ruled a suicide when his girlfriend, Jennifer Chiba, claimed that she was not with Smith when he allegedly stabbed himself. Investigations since have claimed that Smith may have been having an argument with Chiba before his death, and the situation probably escalated to the point where Chiba stabbed Smith twice.
|-
| Gary Speed || 2011 || Welsh footballer and manager, found hanging. Whilst there was evidence that the pressure of management had put some strain on his marriage, and that he and his wife had argued the night before his death, the official verdict of the coroner was a narrative verdict as he could not be sure if Speed had meant to kill himself.
|-
| Steve Stevaert || 2015 || Belgian politician. His body was found by divers in the Albert Canal near Hasselt after being reported missing.
|-
| Ronaldo Valdez || 2023 || Filipino actor. His body, still holding a gun in one hand, was found with at his residence in Quezon City by his driver. He was reportedly experiencing depression and was recently diagnosed with prostate cancer.
